With the UN aiming to end extreme poverty by 2030  see how together we can achieve this goal … and what it will take to go the last mile."

God didn’t give up on Rwanda after the 1994 genocide  and neither did our staff. Peace-building programs—together with our child sponsorship—taught forgiveness  and led to former enemies being best friends today. #GreaterTogether  Be part of this amazing story by sponsoring a child in Rwanda today: http://www.worldvision.org/sponsor-a-child?CL=0053&campaign=3041210

Choyti in Bangladesh is celebrating her 8th birthday today  and you can help make it a happy one! In addition to wishing her a happy birthday  please consider becoming her sponsor. Simply direct message us by clicking the "Message" button in the banner above  and we'll reply with a customized link to her video profile. Thank you! And happy birthday  Choyti!

In 1994  Rwanda was as ruined as any spot on earth after an implosion of violence killed 800 000 people in 100 days. How could the country ever overcome such hatred and horror? It would take a miracle… #GreaterTogether

I was a stranger and you welcomed me. –Matthew 25:35 (ESV). See how Christians in Iraq  displaced by conflict  are focused on surviving together as a community and finding refuge for their children and neighbors. #GreaterTogether

At barely three months old  Arizona should have had a healthy curiosity about the world. But instead  the little heeler pup was anxious and terribly afraid of other dogs.  Learn how clicker training helped this Best Friends Animal Society - Dogtown resident overcome her fears (and land a forever home)! -abigail

At 13  Hurricane Katrina survivor Scratch may be getting on in years  but old age isn't dimming his spirit one bit!  With some special adventures planned by his caregivers  this beloved Best Friends Animal Society - Dogtown resident is truly living life to the fullest. Don't miss this video  and SHARE to help other senior pups like Scratch. -abigail
Since being promoted to the CFO’s office pet  Best Friends Animal Society - Cat World resident Carmelo is taking his new job very seriously. Don't miss this heartwarming story! -abigail

Every time you wear your Snug Life tee  you’ll be supporting Best Friends Animal Society and the ASPCA – and getting tons of compliments  too! Get yours to help homeless pets here: http://bit.ly/Snug-For-Friends. -abigail

Judd might be the happiest dog in the world! Every day is his best day ever. He loves to play all day and to cuddle all night. And if you think his excitement about life is irresistible  just look at his heart-shaped nose! This happy-go-lucky pup enjoys meeting new people and gets along great with other dogs  but he would prefer a feline-free home. Judd can't wait to give a special person a new reason to smile and love life every single day. Could you be his perfect match?  As our Featured Adoptable Pet  Judd flies home for free anywhere in the U.S. or Canada! Apply HERE: bit.ly/AdoptJudd. -abigail

Thanks to a Best Friends grant  No More Homeless Pets Network partner Idaho Humane Society was able to launch a new innovative prison program that gives cats (and inmates) a bright future. Don't miss this inspiring story! -abigail
Pool time? Don't mind if we do! Before you head for the holiday weekend  we hope you enjoy a few of our favorite shots from around the Sanctuary this week. -abigail

While the Fourth of July might be fun for us  our four-legged friends can become stressed with the loud noises and bright lights of the fireworks – and even get lost. Don't miss BarkPost's helpful tips for keeping pets safe this holiday weekend! -abigail

In memory of Vicktory dog Tug  who passed away just yesterday  we're sharing this beautiful moment captured of him and his caregiver  Terry — a true reminder of the bonds created with these incredible dogs. We hope this special footage will bring a smile to your face and serve as a reminder to give your own pup an extra hug today. -abigail

It’s with saddened hearts that we share that beloved Vicktory dog Tug peacefully passed away yesterday. One of the 22 dogs who came to Best Friends in 2008 following the bust of NFL player Michael Vick’s dogfighting ring  Tug was an extremely special dog who shared a close bond with his caregivers  some of whom have shared touching quotes with us in the wake of his passing.  Please join us in taking a moment to celebrate Tug’s life  resilience and the lessons he taught all who knew him. -abigail

Barnaby is a big  playful love bug when he’s among friends. But when he first arrived at Best Friends Animal Society - Dogtown  he was very concerned about stranger danger.  Learn how this shy pup was able to open up to new people with help from one dedicated volunteer! -abigail

We hope you enjoy these fun behind-the-scenes photos from Amanda Seyfried and Finn's shoot for the 9 000 Steps Challenge video! Learn more  watch the video and register for Strut Your Mutt right HERE: bit.ly/StrutYourMutt16. -abigail

Larby is our Featured Adoptable Pet! This outgoing guy likes to be petted  but his favorite thing in the world is for you to talk to him – and he'll roll around on his back when you do! He looks right in your eyes  and you can tell that he's so happy. Larby is a very social  joyful cat who can often been found watching the birds and playing with his feline friends. He would love to be your companion  and we'll fly him home for free anywhere in the US or Canada.  What are you waiting for? Learn more and apply to adopt Larby HERE: bit.ly/AdoptLarby. -abigail

ICYMI: We’re partnering with Amanda Seyfried and Finn for this year’s Best Friends Animal Society - Strut Your Mutt  presented by BOBS from SKECHERS. Get the details and check out her segment on this morning’s Today Show! -abigail

The news is out! We’re so excited to be partnering with Amanda Seyfried and Finn to spread the word about this year’s Best Friends Animal Society - Strut Your Mutt events  presented by BOBS from SKECHERS. Join us by registering and taking the 9 000 Steps Challenge the 9th day of every month — you’ll be helping homeless pets and also getting the chance to win cool prizes along the way!   Learn more and sign up: bit.ly/StrutYourMutt16. -abigail
We’ve got BIG news and we can’t wait to share it with you tomorrow! Tune into the Today Show tomorrow during the 9 a.m. hour to hear our announcement! -abigail
Two years in the making  this mother-daughter getaway to Best Friends Animal Sanctuary was well worth the wait. Get the details on their dream visit! -abigail
Timid Best Friends Animal Society - New York City pup Minnie finally found her confidence — and a forever home  to boot! Don't miss her happily-ever-after. -abigail
From exploring canyons to playing in the water  this week was all about summer fun here at the Sanctuary! We hope you enjoy and have a wonderful weekend! -abigail

We're LIVE from Bunny House at Best Friends Animal Sanctuary in Kanab  Utah! Join us to learn more about our rabbit program  meet some of our adoptables  and get your bunny fix for the day! Plus  you can learn more about rabbit care by checking out our resources here: http://bit.ly/RabbitInformationandResources.

Nestled in the beautiful red rocks of Angel Canyon  Best Friends Animal Sanctuary is a lifesaving haven for hundreds of adoptable animals and our national headquarters (lucky us)! Experience the magic in this piece from PARADE Magazine! -abigail

Summer is here  and our 1 700+ Sanctuary residents are in need of toys  treats  and supplies to beat the heat! It’s easy to make a difference with just a few clicks when you shop our Amazon.com wish list. (Plus  your donation goes even further when you use Amazon Smile!) Check out our most-needed items HERE: bit.ly/SummerWishes16. -abigail

When a man and his new pup's smiling adoption photo recently went viral  it caused a problem in his town of Waterford  Michigan  which currently has law that bans the ownership of certain breeds.   Best Friends believes all dogs are individuals and deserve a chance for a happy life. Learn how we're working to outlaw breed discrimination in this state and others in our latest blog post. -abigail

Are you a proud cat parent? Would you be willing to tell us about your pet’s personality and temperament? We want to hear from you!   Visit the link below to take this survey from our very own Dr. Frank. -abigail

Meet Caffrey! This older gentleman doesn't act his age one bit. Even though he's recovering from knee surgery  he would walk and play tug with you all day if he could. Caffrey can be picky about his canine friends  but he loves every person he meets and is a sleepover favorite. He was even given the nickname "Baby Bear" because he's so loving and cuddly! This smart guy will make someone a fantastic walking buddy  but he'd love to indulge in some mellow lounging  too.  Give senior sweetheart Caffrey a forever home of his own. We'll fly him to you for free as our Featured Adoptable Pet! Apply HERE: bit.ly/AdoptCaffreyFB. -abigail

Happy first day of summer! If you need a laugh this Monday evening  don’t miss this hilarious photo series featuring some of our Sanctuary residents soaking up the rays  taking dips in the water and so much more. -abigail
We're talking about cat care and adoption with PEOPLE Pets! Tune in NOW to meet a few of our adorable Best Friends Animal Society - New York City adoptable kittens. -abigail

Father's Day might be over  but there's still plenty of time to find a new feline friend for your family! During the month of June  cat adoptions are just $10 at Best Friends and participating network partners thanks to our friends at sWheat Scoop.  Is your dad man enough? Get all the details via the link below! -abigail

There’s still time to get Dad the perfect present! This Father’s Day  honor him with a gift to help animals at Best Friends Animal Sanctuary and throughout the country. You can even send him a personalized e-card along with your donation HERE: bit.ly/BestFriendsFathersDay16. -abigail

It's Friday  and you know what time means – kitten selfie time! Okay  we just made that up  but Lori and Hank  as well as the other featured Sanctuary residents  are sure to start your weekend with a smile. Enjoy! -abigail

We're celebrating some of our “dads” at the Sanctuary — the male caregivers who love and care for the animals each and every day.  Hear about the animals who have touched their hearts and made their jobs all the more rewarding in this special piece! -abigail

These featured dogs and cats from our No More Homeless Pets Network partners could use a little help finding their perfect families. And they're counting on us to spread the word!  Meet Dale  Pandora  Maia  Brooklyn and Bronx via the link below  and share their stories with your friends. Let’s get them home! -abigail

We’re excited to announce that we’ve teamed up with Omaze to give you the chance to win a trip to the red carpet premiere of Nine Lives and a photoshoot with famous cats! All entries will support us and the ASPCA. For more information and your chance to win  ENTER: http://bit.ly/NineLivesExperience! -abigail

Best Friends National Conference is heading to our home state of Utah! This July  hundreds of no-kill advocates  all involved in helping this nation end the killing of shelter pets  will descend on Salt Lake City  ready to be educated and inspired. But most important of all  they will leave the conference recharged and ready to save more lives than ever before.  Julie Castle shares why you should join us in our latest blog post! -abigail

When times are dark  our animals are there for us to help make us smile. They always brighten our day and remind us of the meaning of true compassion and tolerance. Enjoy this short video featuring a few of our own favorite moments  and tag a friend who could use a moment of joy today. -abigail

Your dad thinks you’re amazing — even without the cheesy Father’s Day gift. So  skip the coffee mug and save some lovable lives in his name!   Your gift will go straight to work helping thousands of animals at Best Friends Animal Sanctuary and throughout the country. Make it extra special by sending him a personalized e-card along with your donation HERE: bit.ly/BestFriendsFathersDay16. -abigail

Last week  we celebrated National Best Friends Day and invited you to tell us about your four-legged friends. Here are just a few of the sweet  funny and overwhelmingly special stories we received! -abigail

ADOPTION PENDING!  Meet Marley! This friendly and affectionate feline adores everyone he meets – including other cats! Not one for shyness  he’ll prance right up to you for chin scratches and attention. Marley was born in 2010 and originally came from a hoarding situation. But now that Marley is here at the Sanctuary  he’s healthy  happy and ready for a lap to call his own.   If you would like to adopt this lovable guy (with the most incredible green eyes!)  learn more and apply HERE: bit.ly/AdoptMarleyFB. As our Featured Adoptable Pet  Marley flies home for free anywhere in the U.S. or Canada! -abigail

Can you train a cat to enjoy medical handling? Probably not  but can you train a cat to cope and feel less stressed about it? You bet!  Learn how clicker training helped Best Friends Animal Society - Cat World resident Grey overcome her fears and beat stomatitis! -abigail

Best Friends Animal Society - Strut Your Mutt  presented by BOBS from SKECHERS  is finally here! Join us in 14 cities across the nation (or strut virtually!) to help save the lives of dogs and cats in your community.  This is not your average dog walk  so don’t miss the chance to make a big difference for homeless pets. Get all the exciting details and register today via the link below! -abigail
This sweet couple drove all the way across the country to adopt a big brother for their blind dog. We love this story from BarkPost! -abigail

We're ending the week with a happy dance because long-time Parrot Garden resident King O is finally getting adopted! Don't miss this special moment and many others in our Favorite Photos from around the Sanctuary. -abigail

Allergies under control? Check. Good manners? Check. Getting Ireland healthy and happy again was no easy feat  but today  this Best Friends Animal Society - Dogtown resident is ready to take on the world and steal someone’s heart. Get her story! -abigail

Life in a puppy mill is no life for our best friends. Even though more and more Americans are speaking out against them  the U.S. still has about 10 000 puppy mills. Together  we can take a stand against these cruel "factory farms" for dogs and make puppy mills a thing of the past.  You can help with as little as $5. Support Best Friends in our puppy mill initiatives and other lifesaving programs by making a gift today. It’s easy to give by clicking the DONATE button below. -abigail

When Julia Wickerath visited the Sanctuary on her spring break  her little brother Austin had just completed a writing assignment for school about his dream to adopt a puppy.  Though he could not have guessed it at the time  his sister and parents would soon make his wish come true. Don't miss this sweet story! -abigail

Cookie had a rough start  but today his life is truly sweet. From being hit by a car and left in a dumpster to healthy  happy and a beloved family member  watch his transformation story and SHARE to help other animals get a second chance! -abigail

There’s no question that people and pets share a very special bond. So in honor of #NationalBestFriendsDay  we hope you enjoy this photo series that showcases how much we love and appreciate our besties. -abigail

We’re celebrating #NationalBestFriendsDay with PEOPLE Pets! Tune in NOW to learn more about our work to Save Them All and meet a few of our Best Friends Animal Society - New York City adoptable pups. -abigail
Happy #NationalBestFriendsDay! Of course  it’s one of our favorite holidays  so celebrate with us by sharing a photo of you and your four-legged friend in the comments below. -abigail

Look at those empty kennels! This past weekend  a record-breaking 520 dogs and cats (plus five bunnies) found forever homes during our NKLA Super Adoption presented by BOBS from SKECHERS.   What's more  all of the shelter trucks went back empty with Best Friends Animal Society - Los Angeles and our coalition partners taking in the animals who did not get adopted. Thanks to our volunteers  sponsors  partners and supporters  we're one step closer to making LA a no-kill city!  -abigail

After being hit by a car  River was brought to the Best Friends Animal Clinic with a broken pelvis. And while her injury was fixable  getting her to eat proved to be the real challenge.  Learn how this finicky feline's health was restored with the help of food therapy and foster care! -abigail
Puppy belly rubs  curious cats  adorable foals and more – we hope you enjoy this week's Fave Photos as much as we do. From all of us at Best Friends  have a wonderful weekend! -abigail

When Molly's people became sick and could no longer care for her  she needed to find a new home. But being blind  overweight and very shy made that rather difficult.   So she came to Best Friends Animal Society - Piggy Paradise to heal and get healthy. Don’t miss her brave story! -abigail

Is your dad man enough? This Father's Day  bring home a cat!  Thanks to our friends at sWheat Scoop  all cats 6 months and older are just $10 to adopt this month from Best Friends and participating partner shelters nationwide. Get the details and meet your new feline friend HERE: bit.ly/ManEnoughFB. -abigail

Summer break is finally here! Did you know that at Angel Canyon  the home of Best Friends Animal Sanctuary  there are natural swimming holes and parks for our animal residents to play? Check out the fun in this photo series! -abigail

Trinity was only about two years old  but her body showed signs of long-term abuse in a dogfighting ring. The injured pup needed a place to heal  so she came to Best Friends  where love and compassion win.  Don't miss her incredible story of triumph  and SHARE to help other animals like Trinity. -abigail

Take a cat for a hike? You bet! At the Sanctuary  we've found that walking our Cat World residents on harness and leash is a great enrichment activity – and they really enjoy it  too. Learn more in piece from AdventureCats and start planning your visit today! -abigail

A lot of people are surprised to learn that it's not dogs but cats who are killed most frequently in shelters. And that tiny kittens are in danger most of all. But together  we can change this!  The kittens of 2016 have already found 1 074 friends  and they're looking for 942 more. Today is the last chance to help us make this the most lifesaving kitten season yet. Give $5 by clicking the DONATE button below! -abigail

Meet Clearie! This friendly feline is the first one to jump in your lap when you sit down. It's hard to believe he came from a feral colony. He adores people of all ages and absolutely loves attention. He's happy to see anyone and everyone and appreciates a good rub – whether it's behind his ears or by his tail. When it comes to other cats  he can get jealous if they interfere with him getting attention  but he does just fine with dogs! Clearie would like nothing more than a lap to sit in for the rest of his days. Could your family be his perfect match?  As this week's Featured Adoptable Pet  this senior sweetheart flies home for free! Learn more and APPLY to adopt him here: bit.ly/AdoptClearie. -abigail
Need a dose of kitten cuteness? Get an inside peek at our lifesaving Best Friends Animal Society - Los Angeles kitten nursery in this piece from our friends at The Dodo! -abigail
Another fun-filled week has flown by here at the Sanctuary! We hope you enjoy this moment of zen before you head out for the holiday weekend. -abigail

Round-the-clock bottle-feeding and 24-hour care: It’s what newborn kittens need to survive  but most shelters simply can’t provide it. Luckily  Best Friends nurseries can!    With your support  we can make this the most lifesaving kitten season in history. Give $5 to help kittens grow by clicking the DONATE button or visiting HERE: bit.ly/HelpKittensGrow. -abigail

In honor of the kittens of 2016  we’re offering free video e-cards! Actually  they’re more like meditations on kitten cuteness  designed to reduce stress  enhance joy and hypnotize everyone into wanting a kitten. Your friends will love them  and you’ll be spreading the word about all the homeless kittens who need all of our help.  To send a friend a kitten  click HERE: bit.ly/SendAFriendAKitten. -abigail

When newborn kittens arrive at shelters  their little triangle ears are folded like napkins  their eyes are closed and they are extremely vulnerable. Because these little ones need round-the-clock care  which most shelters simply can’t provide  they’re at terrible risk of being killed.  Let’s make this the most lifesaving kitten season in history! Give $5 to help kittens grow up by clicking the DONATE button below! -abigail

Our message to Save them All is a rallying call to the nation that says to every rescuer  to every citizen  that we have a job to do. And it's resonating! For the third time in six years  Best Friends has been named Animal Welfare Nonprofit Brand of the Year based on the 2016 Harris Poll EquiTrend score.   Learn what this means for the no-kill movement in the latest from Julie Castle! -abigail
The weekend is here! Follow Scout's lead – sit back  relax and get ready to enjoy this week's five best shots from around the Sanctuary! -abigail
From abandoned in a parking lot to a beloved member of the baseball team  don't miss Daisy's heartwarming story from BuzzFeed! -abigail

Remember Papaya  the kitty from yesterday's video? This sweet fellow was living outdoors in the Florida heat and so badly injured that the rescue group who found him just couldn’t leave him out there. They took him in  but strangely  couldn’t get his wound to heal. To make matters worse  it turned out he was feline leukemia (FeLV) discordant. That means he tests positive for feline leukemia on one kind of test and negative on another. So to be safe  discordant cats shouldn’t be around either positive cats (who might make them fully positive) or negative cats (who might catch it from them). What a mess!  So Papaya came to Best Friends to recover! Following a much-needed surgery and 24/7 care from our wonderful staff  we’re happy to share that he’s now finally on the road to healing. Can you give just $5 to help Papaya and other animals like him get the care they need? It’s easy to make a gift today by clicking the DONATE button below! -abigail

Life in a puppy mill is pretty miserable – and Gerta knows this all too well. She began her life in a Missouri puppy mill and stayed there for years. But luckily  she was rescued and found her way to Best Friends.  Now  with the help of her caregivers  this once terrified puppy mill survivor is breaking through barriers and learning what she needs to know — to not only survive in the world  but also to make someone a wonderful pet. Don't miss her transformation! -abigail

Papaya arrived at Best Friends Animal Society - Cat World with a severe wound  and after many surgeries  the healing began. Watch this short video to learn how the brave kitty is overcoming his head injury  and SHARE to help us Save Them All! -abigail
For Cookie  the transition from an abandoned and injured kitten to a beloved  pampered pet is the happy ending he deserves. Don't miss this miracle kitten's incredible recovery story! -abigail

Will you take a few moments to write a review of Best Friends and the work that we’re doing to end the killing of pets in our country’s shelters? Your input could help us achieve a GreatNonprofits Top-Rated Award  spreading awareness to Save Them All!   It’s quick and easy to get started HERE: bit.ly/GreatNonProfitsBestFriends. -abigail

Frankfurt is this week's Featured Adoptable Pet! The Chihuahua mix is such a fast learner. People jokingly say that's why his head is so big. But while that may not make him any smarter than he already is  it sure does make him more adorable!  This fun little guy is a ball of energy  but when it's quiet time  he's always down for a good cuddle. Frankfurt is very eager to please and makes friends wherever he goes – whether people or other dogs. He does have some mild anxiety issues but is eager to blossom in a home of his own! Could Frankfurt be your perfect pal? He’ll fly home to you for free anywhere in the U.S. or Canada. Learn more and APPLY: bit.ly/AdoptFrankfurt.  -abigail

Eye issues are no match for feisty kitten Beatrice! Learn how she got the reconstructive surgery she needed to see with help from Best Friends Animal Society - Cat World in this feel-good story. -abigail

Every day that a bird at Best Friends Animal Society - Parrot Garden finds a forever home is a good day. But the day that Nicky went home was one of the best!   After only a few months at the Sanctuary  senior special-needs bird was off to spend his golden years living like a king. Don’t miss his happy story! -abigail

There's still plenty of time to get your mom the perfect present! Just like Mom  an animal's love is unconditional  so this Mother's Day  honor her with a gift to help homeless pets. You can even send her a personalized e-card along with your donation HERE: bit.ly/BestFriendsMothersDay16. -abigail

All month long  adopt any senior Sanctuary dog or cat for free – and we'll even cover their flight home to you! Meet five of our eligible prom dates who are sophisticated and aged to perfection in this special Senior Prom edition of Favorite Photos: bit.ly/BFSeniorProm16. -abigail

Cleaning  feeding and protecting the smallest kittens imaginable is a full-time job  and best done by a mama cat. But what happens when newborn kittens are separated from their mothers?  Meet some of the people who work and volunteer in Best Friends’ nurseries as honorary moms of just about the most adorable baby kittens! -abigail

It’s easy to help our Sanctuary residents with just a few clicks when you shop our Amazon.com wish list. (Plus  your donation goes even further when you use Amazon Smile!) Check out our most-needed items for spring cleaning and beyond HERE: bit.ly/SpringWishes16. -abigail

Sometimes  a sharp pair of eyes  a bit of compassion and some quick action can make all the difference in an animal’s life. That’s certainly true for Diago! The green-eyed tabby cat probably wouldn’t be alive today if it weren’t for an attentive community cat caregiver and help from the Best Friends Animal Clinic.  Don’t miss his incredible recovery story (hint: it includes a forever home!). -abigail

This Mother's Day  honor your mom with a gift to homeless pets and help save some adorable lives in her name! Your gift will go straight to work helping thousands of animals  both at Best Friends Animal Sanctuary and throughout the country.  You can make her gift extra special by sending a personalized e-card along with your donation HERE: bit.ly/BestFriendsMothersDay16. -abigail

Handsome fella Alejandro isn't letting a little thing like FIV get in the way of finding a forever home. Follow the Best Friends Animal Society - Utah resident's journey to happily-ever-after and SHARE to help Save Them All! -abigail

Everyone knows that the maternal bond transcends all species. So what better way to celebrate Mom than with ultra-cute images of animals with their babies?  We hope this photo feature provides a brief diversion from your workday routine with a small dose of squee  wow and awwww! -abigail
We sigh when we're frustrated and when we're happy. But what about our canine companions? Find out what your dog is trying to tell you in this interesting piece from Mother Nature Network! -abigail

Some couples spend their vacation time lying on a beach or touring foreign cities. But for Kim and Mark  volunteering at the Sanctuary is far more fun and rewarding! The Florida couple visits several times a year to spend time with our Best Friends Animal Society - Dogtown residents who need it most.   Don’t miss this feel-good story! -abigail
From bottle-feeding kittens to Opie's "I just got adopted" smile  there's so much cuteness in this week's Favorte Photos. We hope you enjoy and have a wonderful weekend! -abigail

Dexter the pig had a tough start to life  but now  he's found happiness – and has a dog best friend  too! You won’t want to miss his adorable adoption story featuring No More Homeless Pets Network partner Asheville Humane Society. -abigail

Why is she so scared? We’re really not sure  but poor thing Susan is so terrified of everyone and everything that her sister actually sits on her to protect her when people come around!  These two dogs (especially Susan) came to Best Friends nearly paralyzed with fear! And if that weren’t enough  it turns out Susan has heartworm. But now  at least  she’s got access to the best vets in the world  some fantastic dog trainers  loving caregivers  and all the time she needs!  Please make a contribution now to help Susan and others like her will get the ongoing care they deserve and need: Comment #donate and the dollar amount (ex. #donate $20) and we will reply with a short one-time form for you to complete. -abigail
Does your dog enjoy hugs? Learn how you can tell in this informative piece from Mother Nature Network! -abigail
We're well on our way to NKLA! Los Angeles animal shelters are approaching no-kill status with an 84% save rate. Get the exciting details in this piece from the Los Angeles Times! -abigail
From sick and depressed to loved and cared for  foster care truly changed Honey Bee's life! Watch this senior dog's heartwarming transformation  and SHARE to help Save Them All! -abigail

We say  “Together  we can Save Them All” quite a bit at Best Friends. And in 2015  Utah reminded us why.  Our NKUT Coalition partners worked together to find homes for 11 964 homeless pets – a whopping 28% increase in adoptions over the previous year! Learn more about the lifesaving work being done in our home state. -abigail

Looking for a toy-loving running buddy? Say hello to Lordes!  Born in 2012  this energetic pup is completely housetrained and a pro at solving food puzzles. She does suffer from anxiety  but that doesn't stop her from enjoying life and having a ball! When she's not playing outside  Lordes is quite the cuddle monster and would be a great lap dog for an active person. Could this lovable gal be your one and only companion? As this week's Featured Adoptable Pet  we'll cover the cost of her flight home anywhere in the U.S. or Canada! Learn more and apply to adopt Lordes HERE: bit.ly/AdoptLordes. -abigail

Nine years ago today  51 dogs were seized from the estate of football player Michael Vick.  Twenty-two of the most traumatized came to Best Friends  and together  we saved the Vicktory dogs  who were once deemed unsavable. Download and watch The Champions  an inspiring film that follows their lives after rescue  HERE: bit.ly/TheChampionsDocumentary. -abigail

At Best Friends  we work hard to change the negative stigma surrounding feline immunodeficiency virus one incredible kitty at a time. FIV is tough to get  and Symphony is out to prove that she can live normal  healthy and happy life just like other cats.  Meet the quirky and adorable ambassador and learn how she's thriving at Best Friends Animal Society - Cat World! -abigail

Josie's start to life could have been shaky  but she was quickly saved and given the life she deserved. Now  she gives back by taking care of other puppies in need. Don't miss this sweet story from The Dodo! -abigail

Is there a better way to start the weekend than by perusing pictures of adorable animals? We sure don’t think so. Enjoy our favorite shots from the Sanctuary and Best Friends Animal Society - Los Angeles. -abigail

Before coming to the Sanctuary  shy and anxious Alexa had a terrible time making a good first impression  and her attitude wasn’t winning her any friends.  But as it turns out  Alexa just needed to feel at home before she could show that she's ready for one. Learn how she changed her tune at Best Friends Animal Society - Cat World! -abigail

If your family is considering adopting a new pet  don't miss this handy resource! We'll walk you through everything you need to know to help make the integration into your household as smooth as possible. -abigail

Filigree was found on the streets of Missouri by a good Samaritan. It was immediately clear that her back knees were in their locked position  and her hips were a bit wonky  too. So the little kitten came to Best Friends for one-of-a-kind care.  Not having use of her back legs doesn't stop this sweet girl from checking out EVERYTHING! And we’ve ordered special braces to give her better mobility and comfort!  Please help Filigree and other special needs animals by making a donation now ---> Comment #donate and the dollar amount (ex. #donate $20) and we’ll reply with a short  one-time form for you to complete your gift. -abigail

With her fancy name and knack for attracting attention  it’s easy to see why Princess Blue thinks she’s royalty. And now  the outgoing Korat cat is our official Best Friends Welcome Center queen! Don’t miss her story. -abigail

Say hello to Justin! Being born without back feet hasn't slowed this playful puppy down one bit. Learn how he found his footing (and the perfect family!) in this heartwarming video  and SHARE to help special needs pets like Justin find forever homes. Together  we will Save Them All! -abigail

“He’s right behind me  isn’t he?” Barney and Bo have always been pretty tight — a dynamic duo ready to take on life and all of its challenges. Both were born with feline leukemia  a virus that weakens cats’ immune systems and makes them susceptible to secondary infections. Kittens with FeLV are extremely vulnerable in their first year of life  and many don’t make it past their third birthdays. But with help from the Cat World staff and Best Friends veterinary team  the brothers are enjoying good health and beating the odds. Now  they’re ready to find a forever home!   Barney and Bo are the friendliest  purriest fellows and have never met a stranger. Bo is a little less adventurous than his brother  who enjoys going for walks on leash and harness. When they’re not wrestling or playing with toys  these two can often be found cuddled up. Could you be their perfect match? As this week’s Featured Adoptable Pets  Barney and Bo fly home for free! APPLY: bit.ly/BFASMeetBo and bit.ly/BFASMeetBarney. -abigail

Spinning in big  wobbly circles must have been exhausting  but Whistler couldn’t help it. A neurological disorder made it difficult for him to control his body movements.   So  the special pup came to the Sanctuary  where he's spent the past year making great progress and learning how to enjoy life. Don't miss his transformational story! -abigail

Who says you can’t teach an old dog new tricks? 11-year-old Caffrey may not be able to run around like he did in his younger days  but when it comes to learning  the senior pup hasn’t slowed down one bit.  Find out how he's busting this old myth with help from his trainers at Best Friends Animal Society - Dogtown! -abigail

If you’re planning a southwest vacation or looking for places to visit in Utah  Best Friends Animal Sanctuary is a must-see! Nestled in the beautiful red rocks of Angel Canyon just outside the town of Kanab  it’s the largest no-kill pet sanctuary in the country and a true paradise for pet lovers.  Read on to meet the 1 700+ animals who call this place home and learn how to start planning your trip today! -abigail
Diving into the Best Friends National Conference's behind the scenes bustle helped one volunteer find her life’s calling. Don't miss Chrissy's heartwarming story! -abigail

Selfie-taking pups  curious goats and cats playing in the sand – these are just a few of the happy moments in this week's Favorite Photos from around the Sanctuary. From all of us at Best Friends  have a wonderful weekend! -abigail

Most shelter and rescue group volunteers go the extra mile for the animals in their care; however  Lotta Nilsson-May really goes the extra mile — literally. When she walks dogs  the miles add up quickly  and recently  Lotta was crowned the dog walking champ at our NKLA Pet Adoption Center. Get her story! -abigail

Volunteers embody the passion and selfless commitment at the heart of our movement with every minute they give to sit with a shy dog  feed and weigh a tiny kitten  direct traffic at an event  talk to potential adopters  and so much more! This week and every week  we celebrate the volunteers who help us Save Them All.  Don't miss this special message from our CEO and cofounder Gregory Castle! -abigail

Fiesta came to Best Friends from Texas after being rescued from a dogfighting ring. Sadly  Fiesta has babesia  a parasite transmitted from dog to dog through deep bite wounds. When the disease flares up  the petite red girl’s medical care gets complicated and costly. Thankfully  Fiesta is at Best Friends  where she’ll receive all the love and care she needs because of you.   Please support Fiesta and other animals like her by making a donation now!  Comment #donate and the dollar amount (ex. #donate $20)  and we will reply with a short one-time form for you to complete. -abigail
How does your dog say “I love you”? Get the scoop in this fun list from Mother Nature Network! -abigail

A trip to the Sanctuary is good for the mind  body and soul – just ask Fred Winchester! This devoted volunteer visits Best Friends twice a year to help care for the animals and himself. You won’t want to miss his heartwarming story! -abigail

The ballots are in  and the winner of Best Friends’ 2017 calendar cover voting is — Kelvin!  Thanks so much for weighing in on this important issue! Can’t get enough of the cute? As our small way of saying thanks for all you do  get your digital wallpaper featuring our new cover cat! It’s free and easy to download right to your desktop or mobile phone HERE: http://bit.ly/BFASCalendarWinner -abigail

Meet Barney! This sweet senior pup can be shy at first  but turns into a big cuddle bear once you get to know him. At Best Friends – Dogtown  he's learning how to be outgoing and confident. It's all about baby steps! Barney has already mastered leash walking and absolutely loves to go for rides in the car  take walks around the sanctuary  and most of all – go swimming!  Barney is searching for a home where he can continue to blossom. Could your family be the perfect match for this gentle guy? As this week's Featured Adoptable Pet  he flies home for free anywhere in the U.S. or Canada. Apply HERE: http://bit.ly/AdoptBarneyFB. -abigail

In 2014  two leaders in the no-kill movement started the Million Cat Challenge with a goal to save one million cats. And today at 3 p.m. ET  the program will have saved their 500 000th cat thanks to the nearly 400 shelters that have signed on.  Learn more in the latest from co-founder and CEO Gregory Castle and join the virtual party on the Million Cat Challenge Facebook page to help celebrate this incredible milestone! -abigail

Happy Volunteer Appreciation Week! In 2015  Best Friends volunteers logged a whopping 370 000+ hours at the Sanctuary  in our program cities and at events around the country. And we and the animals are thankful for every hour.  All week long  we're celebrating the people who give their time  labor and love toward Saving Them All! Check out this list to see all the ways our volunteers helped homeless pets in the past year! -abigail

One came into the shelter  wounded and shut down. The other came home from war in a similar state. But after a chance crossing of paths at our NKLA Pet Adoption Center  Samson and his new person  Doug Smith  recognized their shared pasts and are now overcoming obstacles together. Don’t miss this story! -abigail

Every animal at Best Friends has a unique story  but our animals with special needs require individual (and sometimes unconventional) care. Your donations ensure these pets get everything they need  exactly when they need it  including those who need extensive or ongoing medical care  as well as animals who just need a little extra time and TLC to overcome emotional or behavioral challenges before finding forever homes.  Now you can give right here on Facebook! Comment with #donate and the dollar amount (ex. #donate $20)  and we will reply with a short  one-time form for you to complete. -melissa

Walk into the Best Friends Visitor Center  and one of the first things you’ll see is Erica  the friendly feline who’s ruled the place since she moved in a few weeks ago.  Learn how this people-loving Best Friends Animal Society - Cat World resident is enjoying life as our official in-town greeter! -abigail

We’re LIVE at our Best Friends Animal Society - Utah Pet Adoption Center with adoptable dog Opie. Join us for a quick walk around the neighborhood to learn more our work and find out how you can help at http://bit.ly/BestFriends16. #24Live

Your vote is needed to help select the Best Friends 2017 calendar cover kitten! Meet the adorable contenders and cast your vote HERE: bit.ly/BestFriendsCalendarVote.   And don’t worry. We won’t tell anyone how long you sit here trying to decide. -abigail

This just in! A company that manages $1.3 trillion has taken a major stand for the animals.  ING  a global bank based in the Netherlands  unveiled a new policy today that will make it easier to support companies that advocate for the humane treatment of animals. Co-founder Francis Battista shares his thoughts on this announcement in our latest blog post. -abigail

Peekaboo  it’s Knox! This friendly feline enjoys being close to people and will climb up to be at your level so he can gaze into your eyes with his beautiful baby blues. Just try to resist his charms! He loves to be petted and can often be found basking in the sun and taking naps around Best Friends – Cat World. This sweet guy does test positive for Feline Immunodeficiency Virus  but cats with FIV can live long  healthy lives – and Knox would love to spend his with you!   Do you have the heart for a fellow like him? Learn more about Knox and apply HERE: bit.ly/AdoptKnox. As this week’s Featured Adoptable Pet  he flies home for free anywhere in the U.S. or Canada! -abigail

Facebook Live is helping us Save Them All! Don't miss this PEOPLE Pets story to learn how the video streaming service recently connected Best Friends Animal Society - Utah adoptable pup Lyra with her perfect family! -abigail

This might be the hardest task you’ve ever faced: Help us select the Best Friends 2017 calendar cover kitten!  With newborn kittens among the most at-risk animals in shelters today  featuring one of these fuzzy faces on the cover of our calendar can raise awareness and help save lives. So  vote for your favorite (that is  if you can choose!) HERE: bit.ly/BestFriendsCalendarVote. -abigail

Ralph is one of Best Friends Animal Society - Dogtown’s most unlikely heroes. The big white dog with the handsome face has overcome a lot in his life. His triumph over fear has done much more than improve his life – it’s made it possible for him to save other lives  too. Don’t miss his brave story! -abigail

Happy April Fools' Day! While the idea of Chihuahuas in platforms may be comical to some  we will not actually be producing footwear for homeless dogs and cats.   Shoes for people  on the other hand  we have covered. Check out the new limited edition BOBS from SKECHERS + Best Friends Animal Society collection: bit.ly/SkechersBOBSforDogs. Each purchased pair of BOBS from Skechers will give back to Best Friends to help Save Them All! -abigail
FRI-YAY – the weekend is finally here! Celebrate with our five best shots from around the Sanctuary. From wrinkly pups to strutting swans  these photos are sure to make you smile! -abigail

On the heels of our announcement about the new BOBS from SKECHERS + Best Friends Animal Society collection  we’re thrilled to share today that we’re collaborating again to design a line of shoes for dogs and cats! Our hope is that these new paw-shaped shoes for pets will make them more adoptable and further our mission to Save Them All.  More details to come  but enjoy a first look at the shoes that will revolutionize animal adoption! -abigail

There are only a few hours left to show your support for the animals on this Love UT Give UT day of giving! Tune in to this special message from our very own Holly Sizemore  and make your $10 gift to help Save Them All HERE: bit.ly/LUGUBestFriendsFB. -abigail

Each evening  the dogs at the Best Friends Animal Society - Utah Pet Adoption Center return to the county shelter to spend the night. They'll be back in the morning  but while they're away  the cats come out to play!   Check out the after hours fun in this short video  and SHARE to help Save Them All. -abigail

We’re so excited to share that a limited edition BOBS from SKECHERS + Best Friends Animal Society collection is now available! Whether you’re a dog lover  a feline addict or just want to sport the Best Friends logo  each pair of BOBS from Skechers will give back to Best Friends to help Save Them All. Learn more and shop: bit.ly/SkechersBOBSforDogs.  Can’t wait to get your hands on the shoes that give back? Enter to win a pair of your own HERE: bit.ly/WinBOBSforDogsFB. -abigail

When it comes to visually identifying an animal's breed  shelter workers get it wrong an awful lot – and mislabeling a dog as "pit bull" could have grave consequences. Read on to learn why co-founder Francis Battista believes removing labels could dislodge negative stereotypes about pit bull terrier type dogs and help save more lives! -abigail

No one knows how Felix was injured  though it’s likely that his esophagus was damaged from an accident or abuse. As a result  he's no longer able to eat solid foods like a normal 14-year-old horse.  Thankfully  Felix found his way to the Sanctuary  where he fit right in. Learn how the handsome quarter horse is getting the specialized diet he needs to thrive at Best Friends Animal Society - Horse Haven! -abigail

Lotti is this week's Featured Adoptable Pet! She is one happy  energetic pup who would love to learn about life in a forever home. She can be picky with her canine friends  so she'd prefer to be the only dog or have a laidback companion. Lotti is super smart and absolutely loves to be around people  too! She can often be found romping around the playyards with her Dogtown caregivers and leaping for lure toys!   Could Lotti be the perfect dog addition to your family? Learn more about her and apply HERE: bit.ly/AdoptLotti. We'll fly her home for free anywhere in the U.S. or Canada. -abigail

Even if your time is short and your house is full of animals  there are many ways you can help further the work of Best Friends. One way is by going shopping! Check out our Amazon.com wish list to view the most-needed items for our 1 700+ Sanctuary residents HERE: bit.ly/SpringWishes16.  -abigail

Shelter Animals Count is a collaborative effort to create and share a national database of shelter animal statistics. To encourage organizations to take part in the project  Maddie's Fund is generously offering $1 000 to every qualifying shelter or rescue organization that registers through April 30.  Think your organization could benefit from a $1 000 grant? Learn more about how to sign up in the latest from co-founder Francis Battista! -abigail

After adopting Tigger the 21-year-old cat  one couple started a bucket list to give the sweet senior kitty the best years yet! Learn about his adventures in this heartwarming story from Mashable! -abigail

Sunbathing piglets  digging dogs and boot-wearing pups – we hope you're ready for the amount of cute in this week's round-up of our Favorite Photos. From all of us here at the Sanctuary  have a wonderful weekend! -abigail

Is your rescue in need of some extra funds? Maddie's Fund is granting $1000 to shelter and rescue organizations who register for Shelter Animals Count. Tell them Best Friends sent you and we will get a grant too! Learn more  sign up and spread the word: http://bit.ly/ShelterAnimalsCountRegistration. #ThanksToMaddie -melissa

With the passage of HB 2250  the Oklahoma State House of Representatives are attempting to prevent national animal welfare organizations from advancing humane policies and practices within the state. Yet puppy mills  which are plentiful in the state  would be protected  as would other factory farming practices.  Read on to get co-founder and CEO Gregory Castle’s thoughts on this piece of legislation (and learn how you can take action to help Oklahoma’s animals!) in our latest blog post. -abigail

This week’s Featured Adoptable Pet is Mitzy! She’s a friendly and happy tabby who absolutely loves attention from people and other cats. Mitzy came to the Sanctuary from a shelter in California  where she lived for six years. And while she currently has a little extra to love  she’s on a diet and making great progress at Cat World. In fact  her favorite pastime is going for walks on a harness and leash!   If you would like to give Mitzy a loving family of her very own  apply today HERE: bit.ly/AdoptMitzy. She flies home for free anywhere in the U.S. or Canada! -abigail

What's it like to attend the Best Friends National Conference? Watch this short video to find out what you’ll learn  hear from past attendees  and discover just how exciting and inspiring the conference truly is.    Don't forget to register today (early bird rates through 4/1!) HERE: bit.ly/BFNC2016. -abigail

With the arrival of our first litter at Best Friends Animal Society - Los Angeles  kitten season has officially begun! And this year  we're teaming up with our NKLA Coalition partners to save more cats than ever before. Find out how new nurseries for neonatal kittens are key to making Los Angeles a no-kill city by 2017! -abigail

These rescue pups adopted two baby ducklings  and we guarantee their photos are the best thing you'll see all day! Don't miss this incredible story of interspecies friendship via Mother Nature Network. -abigail
Snuggling pigs  curious cats  stunning horses and more – there's plenty of cuteness in this week's Fave Photos. We hope these shots from around the Sanctuary bring a smile to your face! -abigail

SeaWorld’s announcement that they’ve pledged their commitment to an entirely new future as a company — a future driven by humane values in keeping with public expectations — is yet another sign that we are in the midst a significant social change with regard to how we treat the animals in the wider world around us.  Don’t miss co-founder Francis Battista’s thoughts on how the no-kill movement has been among the leaders in driving this shift for the animals in our latest blog post. -abigail

Today is the last day to show off your retro Best Friends style! Don't miss your chance to win one of two totes filled with brand new Best Friends merchandise – and snag your free pair of sunglasses.  So  snap a selfie in your favorite gear and enter HERE: bit.ly/RetroGearContest2016. -abigail

Why is Susan so scared? We’re really not sure  but she’s so terrified of everyone and everything that her sister actually sits on her to protect her when people come around. Now that she’s at the Sanctuary  can the little beagle mix learn to relax? The poor girl’s in a constant state of frozen panic. Offer her a treat  and she’ll just stare. She won’t eat it until everyone leaves.  But now she’s got access to the best vets in the world  some fantastic dog trainers  loving caregivers  and time to heal. Can you give just $5 to help Susan and other animals like her get the care they need? It’s easy to make a gift today by clicking the DONATE button below! -melissa

Comedian  actress and writer Whitney Cummings is best known as the co-creator of the CBS series "2 Broke Girls" and creator/star of ‘Whitney.’ Now  with the help of her adopted pups Ramona and Frankie  the talented entertainer is lending her voice to help end the killing of pets in our nation’s shelters.  We’re proud to team up with Whitney and other celebrities to Save Them All. Learn how you can get involved today: bit.ly/SaveThemAllInfo16.  -abigail

Do you remember when you first became a part of Best Friends? Was it way back in the day? Does your favorite tee sport a logo we haven’t used since 2003? We'll even throw in a pair of sunglasses! -abigail

It’s almost lunchtime  and today we have a special treat for you! Watch this short video to see how the Best Friends Animal Society - Piggy Paradise caregivers prepare a resident favorite: delicious flax and fig cookie salad. This tasty dish is sure to be a hit at your next party! -abigail

Each week  we’ll be introducing you to a new pet in need of a forever home  and our first featured adoptable pet is Tig! Since arriving at the Sanctuary  this sweet pup has become quite the agility all-star! Tunnels  tire jumps  hurdles – he loves it all! When he’s not performing tricks with his trainers at Dogtown  Tig enjoys hitting the trails around Angel Canyon and playing with his favorite stuffed animals. He has a full-body wiggle that will melt your heart and gets along great with most other dogs.   If Tig sounds like your perfect companion  learn more and apply HERE: bit.ly/AdoptTig. We’ll waive his flight home anywhere in the U.S. or Canada! -abigail
What is TNR? We'll walk you through why this method for humanely managing community cat populations is so important  as well as what you need to know  in this helpful overview! -abigail
Has the daylight saving time change got you down? These 17 puppy bellies are sure to cheer you right up! Many thanks to BuzzFeed for sharing this adorable piece to promote adoption. -abigail

Whether you've been a fan since the beginning or just learned about us  we want to see your Best Friends style! Snap a selfie wearing your retro gear for a chance to win one of two upgraded prize packs! It’s easy to ENTER HERE: bit.ly/RetroGearContest2016.  The best part? Everyone who submits a photo will receive a code for a free pair of Best Friends sunglasses from our online store! -abigail

Sometimes life’s biggest breakthroughs can be revealed in the smallest movements. For shy former street dog Lava  doing something perfectly ordinary for the first time — like playing with a toy — was a sign of a major step forward.   Learn how Lava was able to unleash her silly side in this inspirational tale! -abigail
Weeble is ready to get the weekend fun started! We hope you enjoy the five happy moments captured in this week's Fave Photos. -abigail

This kitten is one tough Cookie. He’d been hit by a car and was found barely living in a dumpster. But within just a few weeks  the fierce little fighter battled his way back from the brink and is now thriving at Best Friends Animal Society - Cat World. Don’t miss Cookie’s amazing recovery! -abigail

Meet Sundance — this little kitten can meow! He’s got a serious set of lungs. And it’s a good thing  because it was his tremendous meowing that summoned help when he was stranded all alone in pink sand dunes  with no one to take care of him. After his rescue  it was discovered that Sundance needed medical help. His eyelids didn’t form quite properly  so his eyelashes are scratching his eyes. Ouch!    So Sundance came to Best Friends where he’s not only getting the care that every three month-old kitten needs  but he’s also getting help for those irritating eyes. He’s a playful little guy  and very fond of humans. We hope this little orange ball of friendliness will grow up into a big  brave  healthy cat who can open his eyes in comfort! Can you give just $5 to help Sundance and other animals like him get the care they need? It’s easy to make a gift today by clicking the DONATE button below! -abigail

The promotion of looks over substance by breed registry groups has created serious issues that lead to more killing in shelters across the country.  Don’t miss the latest blog post to learn why co-founder Francis Battista believes it’s time for these organizations to take a stand for canine health and play a collaborative role in helping to Save Them All. -abigail

After waiting all her life for a family of her own  Celine has been adopted! Learn how the Best Friends pets of the week promotion gave this longtime Sanctuary resident the spotlight she needed to land the perfect home!  -abigail

From a stray pup living in an abandoned car to the queen of her new home  Tinkerbelle has sure come a long way! Read about the Best Friends Animal Society - Dogtown alum’s transformational journey to happily-ever-after in this piece from iHeartDogs.com. -abigail

Who’s ready to make snow angels? Spring might be right around the corner  but winter is having a few last words here at the Sanctuary.  Watch the animals romp and play in the snowy wonderland  and SHARE this video with your friends and family to help Save Them All! -abigail

(5/5) "Recently we've been hearing a lot in the news about solid tumors getting targeted therapy  but in ovarian cancer it's hard to find a single target because these tumors are very diverse in their genetic makeup. So we have been looking at how to find treatments that are not chemotherapy  but can kill a broad spectrum of tumor cells so we don't have to worry about finding a single target. We are looking to find a compound or a treatment that kills the tumor based on something it depends on to survive."  #WatesVsCancer  Stay tuned … we'll be bringing you more about Rebecca's crowdfunded research later this summer. You can also read more about her here: http://goo.gl/f9Qtqt

(4/5) "During the course of my youth  my mother was diagnosed with breast cancer and survived. So when I got to grad school  at first I wanted to go into breast cancer research. I was looking around at labs to join and met an awesome person  Sharon Stack. She studies ovarian cancer and was an excellent mentor  so things came full circle from my knowledge of my aunt's battle [with ovarian cancer] to finding someone who I thought was a great mentor and would be good for me as a student of science." #WatesVsCancer

Prayer Point: Seven-year-old Marielena Rodriguez was riding her bike at the park with her friends just like she does every Saturday afternoon. Then  the Ecuador earthquake hit—causing a concrete wall to collapse on top of her and break her left leg. Dr. Leland McCluskey  an orthopedic surgeon working with Samaritan’s Purse  inserted pins into her femur to repair the break. While Marielena was in surgery  her mother  Eugenia  became sick and was taken to the emergency room. Doctors discovered that she was malnourished  suffered from a chronic lung disease  and had double pneumonia. When Eugenia heard this diagnosis  she had a panic attack. “She was in a moment of despair ” said one of our chaplains. The chaplain said he was patiently sitting by her bedside  speaking soothing words and spoon-feeding her soup when he sensed God’s leading to speak to her about Christ. In the middle of a busy emergency room  the chaplain shared the Gospel with Eugenia. She recognized her need for a Savior and accepted Jesus. “It’s almost like I felt Jesus say  ‘Come and receive me ’” said Eugenia. Meanwhile  precious Marielena woke up from surgery and found out that her mom was sick. She cried in her hospital bed as she clutched her stuffed doll with pink hair and a dress to match. Crouching beside her bed  a staff member asked her fun questions and played with her doll. Marielena’s tears slowly turned to smiles and laughter—a universal language. In the midst of the devastation  we praise God that we were able to be a beacon of light to the Rodriguez family and others. Most importantly  we’re thankful for the opportunity to point people to the Light of the World as we worked to provide them with physical relief.  “I called to Jesus  and He touched my heart and helped me in my moment of distress ” said Eugenia.   Please pray for Eugenia’s family as she shares her new faith—that they  too  will accept Jesus as Savior. For the people of Ecuador as they continue to recover from the catastrophic earthquake. For our staff and volunteers as they serve the suffering in Jesus’ Name.

Prayer Point: In mid-April  a 7.8 magnitude earthquake rocked Ecuador. It killed hundreds  injured thousands  and turned countless homes  hospitals  and other buildings into piles of stone and rubble. Less than 24 hours after the disaster  Samaritan’s Purse dispatched an emergency response team to one of the hardest-hit areas of the country. With many healthcare facilities damaged or destroyed  we immediately identified an urgent medical need and loaded our recently refurbished DC-8 with our emergency field hospital. It included an emergency room  one operating room  a full pharmacy  and 30 inpatient beds. “I’ve been in many different places with Samaritan’s Purse  but we’ve never had this full capacity ” said Dr. Brianna Wilson. “It’s a really wonderful opportunity to help the Ecuadorian people when their own hospitals couldn’t keep up.” Not only did our teams care for those who were injured  they provided clean water  along with sanitation and hygiene kits  and shelter materials. When Samaritan’s Purse President Franklin Graham arrived in Ecuador less than a week after the earthquake  he witnessed the devastation firsthand. “Children lost parents  and families lost homes and everything they own ” he said. “Please pray for the people of Ecuador. They have a long road ahead of them. They need our prayers.” In the first three days of operation alone  doctors at the emergency field hospital performed 43 surgeries and treated hundreds of patients.   Please pray for the people of Ecuador as they continue to recover from the catastrophic earthquake. For our staff and volunteers as they serve the suffering in Jesus’ Name.

Prayer Point: In the highlands of Papua New Guinea  common disputes— whether among rival tribes or between spouses—all too often end in violence. It was one of those confrontations that landed Marten in Kudjip Nazarene Hospital with a life-changing decision to make. Marten and his wife fought constantly. Tired of the abuse  she slashed his leg with a bush knife. He would have bled to death  but relatives were able to bring him to Kudjip  where he underwent major surgery. Marten was resting in his hospital bed one morning when he heard the sound of people singing. He got up and limped into the hallway. There he found a group of hospital staff and patients holding devotions and singing worship songs. Later Sheena Li  a dentist  accompanied a nurse to Marten’s bedside and shared the Gospel with him. “We spoke of the hope and reason of our joy  and also how Christ is able to make all things new ” explained Li  who serves at Kudjip through World Medical Mission’s Post- Residency Program. “Marten did not want to live his life the way he had been. He repented and wanted to follow Jesus. We explained that this doesn’t mean all his problems will go away ” Li said. “In fact  he will face even more struggles in the days ahead as a new believer. But now he will know Christ’s love and forgiveness and be able to extend mercy to others.” Marten has since been discharged from the hospital  and the chaplain has arranged for the pastor of the church in his village to contact him. For Marten and his wife  the difficult journey toward forgiveness and healing has just begun.   Please pray for Marten to grow in his faith and for healing in his marriage. For Kudjip hospital staff as they share the Gospel of Jesus Christ with patients and their families. For domestic and tribal conflicts in the bush villages to be resolved peacefully.

More than a million people have fled Syria  Iraq  and other troubled regions seeking refuge in western Europe. Now with increased border closings  over 50 000 of these refugees are stalled in northern Greece  Athens  or on the country’s islands. Here they face a long-term stay in detention centers and makeshift camps  many of which lack the basic necessities of food  water  sanitation  and shelter. Samaritan’s Purse is working with the Greek government  international agencies  and local churches to distribute food and supplies and to provide clean water along with proper sanitation.  Learn more and see how you can help here: http://sampur.se/1UvytzI

Prayer Point: Portia Motsa and her husband were unemployed with five children to feed. They live in Swaziland and struggled to make ends meet. To make matters worse  their health was constantly at risk due to their local water supply. The community spring provided locals with a limited supply of water  which the Motsa family often had to fight for. Even when they did get enough water  they often suffered from dysentery and other water-borne diseases  as they had to share their water source with livestock.  One day a local pastor was passing by while Portia was collecting water at the spring. He asked her for a drink. He thanked her  then encouraged her to read John 4:4-42 in the Bible.  On her way home Portia borrowed a Bible from a friend and read the story of the Samaritan woman with Jesus at the well: “Everyone who drinks of this water will be thirsty again  but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never be thirsty again. The water that I will give him will become in him a spring of water welling up to eternal life” (ESV).  “I was so touched by this story  I kept reading it again and again ” Portia said. “Then I sensed that one day God would provide us with clean  sweet drinking water.” But first  she wanted to meet this God who supernaturally provides living water. At church the next Sunday  she chose to follow Jesus. Not only did God save Portia’s soul  He soon provided clean water—fulfilling Portia’s dream. He used Samaritan’s Purse and local ministry partners to cap the community’s spring to prevent contamination. We also installed storage tanks that provide the community with better access to a safe supply of drinkable water. “The Lord has done marvelous things for me and my family. My children are healthy now and no one from our community has become sick.”   Please pray that Portia and her community will thrive  now that they have access to clean water. That Portia will grow in her relationship with Jesus and be a witness to her family and friends. That Samaritan’s Purse will be able to provide clean water to more communities.

Like far too many Houston residents these days  Robert and Antonieta Landry are among those homeowners whose house has flooded more than once. Prayer Point: A bag of food exchanged between a believer and a starving disaster victim can show the love of Christ in a tangible  unforgettable way. In some cultures  it's uncommon to offer help to those of a different religion. So when Samaritan's Purse partners with brave brothers and sisters in difficult places to bring relief and show compassion without discrimination  solely for the sake of the Gospel  it speaks loudly. Recently  we partnered with churches in South Asia to provide emergency food and clean water to thousands of flood victims—many of them poor  mistreated farmers. Our teams reached out to Muslim  Hindu  and Christian families and saw God using their efforts to touch hearts. One of the recipients was a young mother named Nida. Her husband had abandoned her and their four children  and they now live with her elderly parents. Nida doesn't have skills to support her children and sick father  so she took a job as a farm laborer. During the flooding  Nida was working in the fields and didn’t know the water was rising in her home and threatening the lives of her family. Fortunately  they were rescued; but by the time Nida arrived  their home was lost. The fields where she works were also ruined. When our church partner gave food to her family and showed them a tangible expression of God’s love  it lifted Nida's spirits  and she expressed her gratitude. During this flood response  the pastoral teams prayed before every distribution. A Hindu community became receptive to building relationships with them. One Christian community told the pastors that the relief items encouraged their faith in God's provision. And  the pastors could tell many more stories of lives and communities changed.  Please pray That Nida and other flood victims in South Asia will come to faith in the Lord Jesus. That our church partners will be safe as they proclaim the Gospel in dangerous places. That God will give us more opportunities to help the oppressed and share the message of freedom in Christ.

The refugees who arrived in northern Greece are here only after a series of difficult and  at times  heart-breaking decisions forced on them by extremes of inhumanity.   "They said only two of us could go. I had to choose which ones " one refugee said  recounting his family's entrapment by ISIS.   Some arrive with their entire families  having left behind good lives made tragic by constant conflict. So now  perhaps for the first time  they sleep in tents amid a city of tents where food is prepared over barrel fires.  Though they are provided food  they want to prepare it themselves and will often re-cook the food we give them  because they want to do something to make where they are living feel like home. It could be home for a very long time.

The many children in the refugee camps of northern Greece are an ever-present reminder of why many refugee families have risked all they have to flee their countries. They want the next generation to have a fighting chance at an education and a future.

Prayer Point: Five years ago  Chantal Kantungu’s husband was murdered in the war that has plagued the Democratic Republic of the Congo for more than 20 years. She decided to move with her eight children to another town  where she thought they would be safe. A local family hosted them  and they no longer feared that they would be killed. But a new enemy chased them—hunger. In their new town  Chantal was unable to find work and resorted to begging on the streets with her children. Eventually  neighbors of their host family gave Chantal and her children the opportunity to work in their fields. That allowed them to find food  but it wasn’t enough. They still lacked many necessities. When Samaritan’s Purse began working in the town where Chantal was living  we provided her with seeds  tools  and training. Since then  she’s planted her own garden and has already reaped 49 bundles of amaranth grain. “I consumed part of the crop and sold another part of the harvest ” Chantal said. “I used that money to buy soap  salt  oil  etc. I say thank you to Samaritan’s Purse—and to God  too—because  with this help  I now manage to support myself and to support my children.” In nearby towns  we are providing emergency food  blankets  tarps  hygiene kits  and other essentials to people displaced by conflict. “We have learned the value of sharing the love of God to all ” said Masika Salumu  another beneficiary. “This message touched us because  during times of hunger  it is sometimes difficult to think of others.” God is using Samaritan’s Purse to equip people with resources and a sense of ownership to give hope to those who have been thrust into unrest and uncertainty. War victims can now hold themselves with dignity because they’re beginning to truly understand the love of Christ.  Please pray for Chantal’s continued success with her fields. That Samaritan’s Purse can continue to support those who have been displaced by war in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. For war victims to find peace and hope in Jesus Christ.

Prayer Point: Five-year-old Gideon arrived at Gifted Kids Kindergarten with a reputation. He had already been kicked out of numerous other schools for bullying in his town of Tsumeb  located four hours north of Namibia's capital of Windhoek. His first days in teacher Toneth Mercado’s kindergarten class were no different. He talked a lot during class  swore often  and fought with the other children. But Toneth saw through his behavior to his heart. “He lacked love from his mother ” she said  pointing out that Gideon is being raised by his grandparents. Gideon didn’t live up to his reputation for long. “When I started teaching them God’s Word through The Greatest Journey  he began to change ” Toneth said. This discipleship course  developed by Samaritan’s Purse for children who receive Operation Christmas Child shoeboxes  showed her students how to follow Jesus and share Him with others. In Lesson 4  they learned that Jesus is the Greatest Friend because He took the punishment we deserve through His death on the cross. During that lesson  Gideon accepted Jesus as his Savior. Toneth believes her students particularly connect with this lesson. “In Africa  parents are often separated ” she said. “Children are longing for love  longing for a friend.” Now with Jesus as his Greatest Friend  Gideon gets along with the other children in his class. When the others fight  he walks away. He is always helpful and quickly obedient  seeking to assist his teacher. At home  Gideon’s grandparents noticed the transformation as well. It especially meant a lot to his grandfather  who used to be an elder of Moria Church. Gideon loves telling his uncles  cousins  and friends about his new faith in Jesus. “Let your light so shine before men  that they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven” (Matthew 5:16).  Please pray for Gideon to grow as a disciple of Christ and as an evangelist. For each of the 1.8 million children currently enrolled in The Greatest Journey to “love the Lord your God and serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul” (Deuteronomy 11:13). For local believers to respond to God’s call to teach The Greatest Journey.

Meet Sokny. She is an 18 year old expectant mother. She arrived at the Samaritan’s Purse community birthing center in the morning and was due to give birth to her first child any day. She laid on the bed  sat up on the bed  paced back and forth outside  and finally sat down outside in a white plastic chair. Nothing eased the pain.  Despite her physical agony in those anxious hours awaiting delivery  Sokny could do her waiting at the birthing center  giving her more hope for a safe delivery than most women in Kratie Province have ever known. It’s a hope that until a few years ago was all but forgotten in the remote  impoverished province hundreds of miles from a city or a hospital. Prayer Point: A last-second decision to exchange a gift bag may have saved Alondra Acosta’s life. It certainly became the springboard for a spiritual transformation in her heart. Alondra was getting ready for a wedding the Saturday evening after Christmas when she thought the gift bag for her present appeared too small. She decided to go exchange it. On her way home  fierce lightning crisscrossed the dark sky. Heavy rain pelted her car. Then tornado sirens blared. Alondra knew she couldn’t make it back to her mobile home in the Dallas suburb of Rowlett  so she stopped in an adjacent neighborhood. She pounded on the front door of a house but no answer. She screamed as she saw the tornado bearing down in her direction. With wood whizzing past her head  she grabbed a column of porch bricks and held on for dear life. Seconds later  utter silence. Still trembling  Alondra peered around her. No damage to the house where she was  but others around her were destroyed. She drove back to the mobile home park and found her home obliterated. Her Chihuahua was cowering under some rubble. Alondra heard about Samaritan’s Purse disaster relief at a nearby church and asked for help. On a blustery New Year’s Day  our volunteers cleared debris  chainsawed downed trees  and neatly assembled her belongings. As the work was winding down  Team Leader Bill Burden talked with Alondra and shared how much God loves her and how Jesus Christ had died for her sins. Alondra prayed to receive Him as her Savior. As the 18 volunteers circled up to present a Bible to Alondra  Bill announced to the group: “I want to introduce you to a new sister in Jesus Christ.” They clapped and cheered. Alondra’s smile beamed. “This is a special morning ” Alondra said afterward. “Definitely  definitely. God spared me because He knew you guys were coming today.”  Please pray that Alondra will grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. That when future disasters strike  our volunteers will minister with strength and sensitivity. That God will give our U.S. Disaster Relief Team wisdom to lead this vital ministry.

Prayer Point: As the sun rises and the sound of birds is heard throughout the land singing praises to the King of kings  men in Northern Bahr el Ghazal State  South Sudan are preparing for the day’s work. Each morning  the men travel to the nearby river readying their nets and hand-dug canoes hoping to catch enough fish to feed their families. So far  Samaritan’s Purse has trained 500 men on improved fishing techniques. They also received hooks and twine to weave fishing nets  a process that takes about three weeks to complete. For these men  fishing is the primary means of earning a living and providing food for their families  as the conflict in South Sudan has all but eliminated the opportunity to plant and harvest crops. An estimated 3.9 million people are now considered “severely food insecure.” Though South Sudan  the world’s youngest nation  continues to experience tragedies of war and violence  good things are still taking place here. Leno Machar  one of the project participants  shares: “We used to sell our livestock to buy twine to make nets and fishing hooks  but the harvest was so bad last year we had to sell all our cattle in order to buy food. We are very grateful to be part of this group and receive twine to make nets and fishing hooks. It means we will be able to feed our families and even sell the extra fish in the market to bring extra income so we can buy other grains and household items.” The project is not only equipping men to learn a valuable trade to sustain their families  it’s also demonstrating the Lord’s compassion and provision as His love is extended and demonstrated. “When [Jesus] had stopped speaking  He said to Simon  'Launch out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch'" (Luke 5:4).  Please pray that the fishermen are able to catch enough fish to provide for their families and earn a living. That peace would come soon to South Sudan and that the people will come to know true peace offered only by God through Jesus Christ. For safety and protection of the Samaritan’s Purse team working in South Sudan.

#TBT Before receiving cleft lip surgery  Teng's mother had to withdraw him from school. Believed by many to be an evil omen  a cleft lip in South Sudan sentences a person to a life of limited opportunities and public ostracism. In addition  a cleft lip can cause problems eating  drinking  and speaking  as well as lead to frequent ear infections and sinus problems. After his successful surgery  his mother  Alek  said “Now  no problem  I will just take my baby back to school.”  Next week our team will return to South Sudan to preform cleft lip surgeries. Please be in prayer for our medical team and the men  women  and children just like Teng who will be traveling across the country to receive cleft lip surgery.
